info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 5 at 11:31AM EDT until April 5 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Ohio, including the following counties, in north central Ohio, Ashland, Knox and Richland. In northeast Ohio, Holmes and Wayne.
* WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT Saturday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1129 AM EDT, the department of transportation and members of the public reported flooding in the advisory area and urban and small stream flooding will continue through the afternoon. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mansfield, Wooster, Ashland, Mount Vernon, Millersburg, Shelby, Orrville, Berlin, Rittman, Ontario, Lexington, Crestline, Walnut Creek, Doylestown, Gambier, Creston, Plymouth, Dalton, Centerburg and Shreve.
- Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Ashland, OH; Holmes, OH; Knox, OH; Richland, OH; Wayne, OH
